content:
The final open call for financial (Route 2) support will be open for applications from 9th October-4th December 2024.

Applicants can apply to join the following support actions:

  • 1: Managing data types, schemas and vocabularies and crosswalks for FAIR researcher related metadata. Successful applicants will receive 5000 € to support their participation.
  • 2: Creating EOSC compliant interoperability policies based on EOSC Interoperability Framework (IF). Successful applicants will receive 5000 € to support their participation.
  • 3: Testing the trustworthy and FAIR-enabling repositories prototype. Successful applicants will receive 5000 € to support their participation.
  • 4: Implementation of a shared API for semantic catalogues. Successful applicants will receive 8000 € to support their participation.

Who can apply ?
This call is open to individuals, groups or organisations from public and private research-performing organisations, including:

  • Research-performing organisations and research infrastructures;  
  • Repositories, data and metadata service providers; 
  • Representatives of national and international level initiatives. 

Applicants must reside and/or work in an EU or Associated Country for the duration of the grant. A key aim for FAIR-IMPACT is to prioritise support for organisations, groups, and/or individuals based in countries or representing domains that are currently less advanced in terms of their FAIR enabling capacity2.

The call is not open to individuals or groups based at any of the FAIR-IMPACT project partner organisations nor to individuals who hold the status of FAIR Champions under FAIR-IMPACT.

A webinar to showcase the support actions on offer and grant platform open for applications is planned 09 October 2024 14-15 CEST

More info : https://fair-impact.eu/3rd-open-call-route-2-support-opens-30-sept
KU Leuven will likely be applying for number 3. It's a follow-up on one we did previously, if I remember correctly.
